Authors: S. A. Freire, Arne A. Anderberg
Title:
A cladistic and biogeographic analysis of the Lucilia group
(Asteraceae, Gnaphalieae).
Journal: Botanical Journal of the Linnean Society
Abstract:
The Lucilia group (Asteraceae, Inuleae- Gnaphaliinae)
sensu Merxmuller el al.Â is revisited and its phylogeny analysed by means
of computerized parsimony program (Hennig86). Cladograms and strict
consensus trees are presented and discussed. A sequential model of the
vicariance biogeography of the Lucilia group is presented and its
implications on the historical biogeography of South America is
discussed. The following genera are recognized as belonging to the
group: Belloa, Berroa, Chevreulia, Cualrecasasiella ( = Luciliopsis
auct.), Facelis, Jalcophila and Lucilia. Also belonging to the Lucilia
group are the two genera Gamochaetopsis and Luciliocline. A key is given
to the nine recognized genera, each of which is described here with
brief descriptions and lists of recognized species.
